title: Welcome to My Personal Website
text:
My Favourite Dog


Hello! I‚Äôm Bryan, a passionate learner and explorer with a strong interest in technology, creativity, and problem-solving. I‚Äôm currently studying at Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), where I‚Äôm pursuing my academic and professional growth in a hands-on, application-driven environment.

From coding and software development to data analysis and AI tools, I enjoy diving deep into technical challenges and building meaningful projects. This website serves as a space to showcase my journey, projects, and interests outside of the classroom.
I created this website not only to document my learning experiences but also to share the things I enjoy‚Äîfrom personal hobbies to tech experiments and reflections on new tools like Generative AI.
Whether you‚Äôre here to check out my work, get inspired by my favorite movie, or see what I‚Äôm currently learning‚Äîthank you for stopping by!

title: My Favorite Show: Breaking Bad
text:
Breaking Bad Poster


Breaking Bad is widely regarded as one of the greatest TV shows of all time. Created by Vince Gilligan, this drama follows Walter White, a chemistry teacher turned meth manufacturer.



‚ÄúThe transformation of Walter White from mild-mannered teacher to dangerous criminal is portrayed with incredible nuance and depth.‚Äù


Character Development: The evolution of characters feels realistic and compelling
Moral Complexity: Explores gray areas of morality without taking sides
Writing Excellence: Tight plots with no wasted scenes
Performance: Outstanding acting, particularly Bryan Cranston and Aaron Paul




What resonates with me most is the exploration of how ordinary people can be pushed to extremes. The show made me reflect on: - The potential for good people to do bad things - The consequences of pride and greed - How circumstances can gradually change someone‚Äôs moral compass




‚ÄúOzymandias‚Äù - The pinnacle of television writing
‚ÄúGliding Over All‚Äù - The perfect conclusion to Walter‚Äôs journey
‚ÄúFace Off‚Äù - Incredible tension and payoff

If you haven‚Äôt watched it yet, I highly recommend giving it a try!

title: Personal Project
text:
This project explores how volatility forecasting can support data-driven stock trading decisions. Using financial data and statistical modeling, the system analyzes stock behavior and identifies low-volatility periods that may serve as favorable buy signals.



Volatility Forecast






Python (Main development language)
yFinance (Stock data retrieval)
Selenium (Web scraping)
GARCH (Volatility modeling)
Matplotlib & mplfinance (Data visualization)
Google Colab (Development platform)





Forecasts stock market volatility using GARCH models
Integrates technical indicators such as moving averages and Bollinger Bands
Interactive interface to select and visualize individual stock data
Provides analytical insight into market behavior during low-volatility periods





Implementing and tuning GARCH models for financial time series
Cleaning and aligning noisy or missing stock data
Balancing predictive accuracy with interpretability
Visualizing multi-dimensional financial indicators effectively





Identified potential low-volatility buy zones in various stocks
Built an interactive, data-driven tool to assist in stock analysis
Improved understanding of quantitative finance and market behavior

title: Hobby
text:
Drawing with pencils has always been a relaxing and rewarding hobby for me. I enjoy the level of control and precision it offers, and how something as simple as a graphite pencil can be used to create detailed, expressive artwork. It‚Äôs a creative outlet that helps me slow down, focus, and observe the world more closely.



Pencil Sketch






Graphite Pencils: Ranging from 9H (hardest) to 9B (softest) for different textures and shading
Mechanical Pencils: For fine details and line consistency
Erasers:

Kneaded Eraser: For subtle lightening and highlights
Vinyl Eraser: For clean, precise erasing

Blending Tools:

Tortillons and Blending Stumps for smooth gradients
Cotton Swabs and Tissue for broader blending

Sketchbook: Acid-free, medium-to-heavyweight paper with slight texture
Fixative Spray: To preserve finished drawings and prevent smudging





Shading & Gradient Control
Practicing smooth transitions from light to dark to create volume and depth.
Hatching & Cross-Hatching
Using lines and layered strokes to build tonal value and texture.
Contour Drawing
Focusing on the outline of subjects to capture form and proportion accurately.
Reference Drawing
Drawing from life or photographs to improve observation and realism.
Texturing
Developing techniques to render materials like skin, fabric, hair, and metal using pencil strokes.
Negative Space Drawing
Focusing on drawing the space around an object to improve spatial awareness and composition.





Achieving Realism: It can be difficult to balance detail without overworking a drawing.
Smudging: Graphite easily smudges, requiring careful hand positioning and occasional fixative application.
Proportions & Perspective: Maintaining accurate anatomy and depth, especially in portraits and architecture.
Time Management: Pencil drawing can be time-consuming, especially for high-detail pieces.





Improved hand-eye coordination and observation skills
Deeper appreciation for light, form, and visual storytelling
A growing portfolio of artworks that reflect my progress
A relaxing and screen-free creative practice I can return to anytime






‚ÄúDrawing is not what one sees but what one can make others see.‚Äù ‚Äî Edgar Degas

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
Using Generative AI (GenAI) tools like ChatGPT has been a unique and eye-opening experience throughout this assessment. I chose to use ChatGPT by OpenAI because of its flexibility, speed, and ability to assist in both technical and creative tasks.


The GenAI tool helped me in multiple ways:

Clarifying Instructions: When I wasn‚Äôt sure how to format YAML files or structure .qmd pages, ChatGPT explained the correct syntax and caught errors like indentation or missing keys.
Fixing Code: It quickly helped debug my Quarto configuration and provided corrected Markdown and HTML code for embedding links and images properly.
Improving Content: I asked for help in refining my writing and organizing my reflections logically. For example, when I needed help writing this page, ChatGPT gave me a well-structured draft to build on.





Time-saving: I spent less time searching for documentation because I could ask direct questions.
Learning Aid: It explained not only the ‚Äúwhat‚Äù but also the ‚Äúwhy,‚Äù helping me understand the reasoning behind the solutions.
Creativity Support: It offered ideas and phrasing suggestions that made my writing clearer and more engaging.





Over-reliance Risk: It‚Äôs tempting to just copy-paste answers without fully understanding them. I had to make sure I still learned and reviewed the material myself.
Accuracy Checks: Sometimes the responses need verification, especially when dealing with code or specific formatting requirements.




In the future, I believe GenAI tools will be valuable companions in both academic and professional settings. They can support brainstorming, research, writing, coding, and even learning new skills‚Äîprovided they‚Äôre used responsibly.



Using GenAI has not only helped me complete the assessment efficiently but also taught me how to collaborate with a new type of digital assistant. I see it as a tool to amplify human creativity and productivity, not replace it.

Tools I Used
